spec.name: South American Mutual Mortgage Company Building
spec.description: The South American Mutual Mortgage Company Building (Société mutuelle hypothécaire sud-américaine) is a historical residential and commercial structure completed in 1929. It was designed by the prominent duo **Marius Boyer and Jean Balois**. This building reflects the international investment and architectural ambition of the Art Deco era in Casablanca, particularly concerning foreign financial institutions. It remains an inhabited building.

people.comment: French architect who co-designed the building.

access.comment: Building is inhabited; exterior view is public, interior access is restricted to residents/tenants.
